intro: Rauvolfia letouzeyi, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds. Rauvolfia letouzeyi is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
